intro: Sphaeranthus chandleri, commonly known as Chandler's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with tightly packed, woolly leaves and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes. Sphaeranthus chandleri is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
